material: The materials, elements or substances that are mentioned as a participant in a fuel cell experiment.
device: The device used in the fuel cell experiment.
experiment: The experiment-evoking verb such as test, perform, and report
value: Numerical values and their respective units.
support_material: The frame-evoking element and the material that makes up the support of the cell.
experiment_evoking_word: The experiment-evoking verb such as test, evaluate,measure, or generate
fuel_used: The chemical composition or the class of a fuel or the oxidant species (indicated as a material).
power_density: The values of the (maximum/peak) power density obtained from a device.
current_density: The value of the current density of that experimental setup.
working_temperature: The value of the temperature at which the cell is operated or at which a certain experiment has been performed.
time_of_operation: The value of the duration of an experiment. The duration of an experiment can be expressed in hours or as a number of RedOx cycles.
voltage: The value of the voltage at which a cell was operated. Not to be confused with open_circuit_voltage.
anode_material: The material that makes up the anode. Including the fuel electrode (even in case of electrolytic cells), the ion conductive material in a composite anode (even if the electrolyte is made of the same material).
cathode_material: The material that makes up the cathode. Including the oxygen electrode as a cathode material (even in case of electrolytic cells), the ion conductive material in a composite cathode (even if the electrolyte is made of the same material).
electrolyte_material: The material that makes up the electrolyte.
resistance: The electrical resistance of a cell or cell component. In SOFC experiments, the resistance is usually expressed in area specific units: Ω cm2.
degradation_rate: The degradation rate of the cell, which can be also expressed as a percentage.
open_circuit_voltage: The value of the open circuit voltage (OCV) obtained from a device.
conductivity: The electrical conductivity of a certain cell or cell component. Electronic and ionic conductivites can be distinguished via the corresponding entries in the knowledge base.
interlayer_material: The material used as interlayer or buffer layer in a SOFC.
